reason: Escalating macro trade tensions, surging global borrowing costs, and options market data pointing to a significant chance of falling below $80,000 indicate strong bearish pressure. Bitcoin is already declining, suggesting a risk-off environment where investors are likely reducing exposure to speculative assets.
headlines: Tech index futures, crypto stocks drop as U.S.-Europe trade tensions rise, bitcoin falls
Trouble mounts for bitcoin and stocks as global benchmark for borrowing costs surges
Yield trading platform Pendle debuts new token to boost user capital efficiency
'White Whale' memecoin slides 60% after top holder dumps $1.3 million
Bitcoin has a 30% chance of falling below $80,000 by late June, options data suggests
